metadata.Title: CVE-2020-2655 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: Vulnerability in the Java SE product of Oracle Java SE (component: JSSE).Supported versions that are affected are Java SE: 11.0.5 and 13.0.1.Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker withnetwork access via HTTPS to compromise Java SE. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access tosome of Java SE accessible data as well as unauthorized read access to asubset of Java SE accessible data. Note: This vulnerability applies to Javadeployments, typically in clients running sandboxed Java Web Startapplications or sandboxed Java applets (in Java SE 8), that load and rununtrusted code (e.g., code that comes from the internet) and rely on theJava sandbox for security. This vulnerability can also be exploited byusing APIs in the specified Component, e.g., through a web service whichsupplies data to the APIs. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.8 (Confidentiality andIntegrity impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N).

criterions.comment: icedtea-web: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
